page_analysis.text_content:
2nd & 3rd floor equivalency

Areas higher than 17' and 26' above the first floor (that do not already count as floor area e.g., open atrium spaces and inaccessible attic spaces), count toward the gross floor area in the form of 2nd and 3rd floor equivalency regardless of the floor plan or usage of the space. Stairwells will be measured the same way that vaulted ceiling spaces are measured.

In the examples of Fig 12 below the highlighted areas count as follows:

Area A
• once as 1st floor,
• again as 2nd floor, and
• a third time as 3rd-floor equivalency

Area B
• once as 1st floor,
• again as 2nd-floor equivalency

Note: 200 sf of 3rd floor equivalency may be exempted where roof pitch is 4:12 or steeper (see “Height” section).

Fig 12 2nd & 3rd floor equivalency

17

visual_elements.description:
Figure titled 'Fig 12 2nd & 3rd floor equivalency'. It contains two side-by-side cross-sectional diagrams of a building to illustrate how floor area equivalency is calculated for high-ceiling spaces. 

Left Diagram: Shows a two-story structure with a stairwell. Areas are highlighted with diagonal hatching. 'Area A' is a vertical space extending from the 1st floor through the 2nd floor and into the attic. 'Area B' is the stairwell. Horizontal dashed lines indicate height thresholds of 17' and 26' above the first floor. Annotations with arrows define which parts of the vertical space count towards different floor equivalencies. 'Width of area that counts as 2nd floor' is shown for the first floor space. 'Width of area that counts as 2nd-floor equivalency' is shown for the space between 17' and 26'. 'Width of area that counts as 3rd-floor equivalency' is shown for the space above 26'. The attic space is labeled 'Inaccessible attic (or vaulted ceiling)'. The first floor is labeled '1st flr' and 'Top of finished floor (Typical)'. The roof is labeled 'Top of roof material (Typical)'.

Right Diagram: Shows a structure with a vaulted ceiling space. 'Area A' is a vertical space extending from the 1st floor into the attic. 'Area B' is a vaulted ceiling space over the 1st floor, labeled 'Vaulted ceiling space'. Similar to the left diagram, it uses horizontal dashed lines at 17' and 26' and annotations to show how areas are counted for 2nd and 3rd floor equivalency. The attic is labeled 'Inaccessible attic (or vaulted ceiling)'. The first floor is labeled '1st fl'.
visual_elements.location: Middle and bottom of the page

visual_elements.description: A dark grey rectangular box with white text, positioned in the upper right quadrant of the page. It contains a 'Note' regarding an exemption for 3rd floor equivalency.
